Por otro lado, no le gusta que algunos de sus clientes se demoren en el pago de los créditos que les otorga, considerando la posibilidad de ya no brindar crédito, para así poder tener más efectivo en sus manos e invertir en ampliar su negocio.

Este es su préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP y se siente contenta de poder contar con el apoyo y avanzar en su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además, de sentirse cómoda con su grupo de su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros, para surtir y aumentar el disponible de mercadería en su bodega.
texts.en:
Natividad is 51 years old. She’s a hardworking and joyful woman. She’s separated from the father of her children. Right now she lives with her elderly mother and her son, Joel, who’s 28 years old. She inherited the house where they live from her father.

She sells groceries and foodstuffs. To do that she opened a store in her home since she really needed the money and the payments and economic support from her ex-partner wasn’t enough. She decided to start this business more than 6 years ago, and in time she’s been able to grow and expand. She likes her work since it allows her to socialize with her neighbors, have more friendships, talk about things that interest her, and feel like a busy and productive person. Thanks to the income, she’s been able to afford the household costs. On the other hand, she doesn’t like that some of her clients are late in repaying the credit she’s extended them, so that she can have more cash on hand and invest in the growth of her business. 

This will be her 11th loan with MFP and she’s happy to get the help and advance her business. For that reason she promises to be punctual in the repayment of her loan. Also, she’s comfortable with the communal bank group since she considers the members to be responsible and team-minded. 

With the amount of 1500 nuevos soles that she’s requested, she’ll invest in the purchase of groceries and foodstuffs like rice, sugar, noodles, etc. to expand the supply of merchandise in her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, etc.) to stock her store.

loans.name: Mahukpego 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO 3 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Yabo est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Yabo est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Yabo est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Laurent. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et seulement un reste à leur charge. Yabo vit seule avec son enfant et assure ensemble avec son mari, ses divers besoins et ceux de son enfant. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Yabo mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d'années, la vente des produits cosmétiques (parfums, poudre) dans sa région. Yabo s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Yabo sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO 3, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Mahukpego group is made up of 3 people who are friends and live in the same neighbourhood. This is the 3rd time that this group is requesting financial help from ALIDé, so that they can raise the level of their business activity.

The group's representative, called Yabo, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. Yabo is 37 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a driver called Laurent. The couple have 5 children, some of whom are educated, and only one of whom is still dependent on them. Yabo lives alone with her child and she and her husband both take care of her needs and those of their child. In order to be able to provide for herself, Yabo has been selling beauty products (perfumes and powders) in her region for around 20 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction as well as increased sales and revenue, Yabo is requesting, together with the other members of the Mahukpego group, a 3rd loan from ALIDé. The first 2 loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy perfumes.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon lives in Montol, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. For 5 years he has earned through providing transportation services so as to support the needs of his 4 children. He gets an income of 3,000 PHP a month from this business. For a 29-year-old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy except to see his children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Marlon borrows an amount of 5,700 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair his transport vehicle used in his business and provide his children a better education. He joined GDMPC in 2010. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair his transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is a 31-year-old business lady in Kikambala, Kilifi. She runs a video entertainment business in Kilifi town and has been in the business for 10 years. Her business has been doing well and she has been able to entertain her clients, most of whom are the Kilifi youths.

This marks her first business loan from KADET LTD and she plans to refurbish the video premise by repairing the seats and walls of the premise. She also plans to start a juice business that will mainly target her clients. 

She hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand her business and hopes to have a more profitable business in future.

loans.use: to refurbish the video premise by repairing the seats and walls of the premise

loans.name: Wangninan 20 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAN 20 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et dont deux appartiennent à une même famille. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Denise Dossignon est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Denise Dossignon est âgée de 49 ans et vit au Bénin. Denise Dossignon n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Denise Dossignon est mariée à un certain Blaise. Le couple n’a que deux enfants à leur charge dont aucun scolarisé et aucun n’est leur propre enfant. Denise Dossignon vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec  son mari les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Denise Dossignon vend depuis cinq ans, des assiettes et des chaussures par le système de distribution. Parallèlement à cette activité, Denise Dossignon vend des jus de bissapes. Denise Dossignon s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Denise Dossignon sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAN 20, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra certainement à hausser le niveau de leurs activités et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
WANGNINAN 20 is a group of three friends, two of whom are related. This is the group’s first time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. The group’s representative is Denise Dossignon, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Denise Dossignon is 49 years old and she lives in Benin. She never went to school. She is married to a man named Blaise, and they have two dependent children in their care. The children are not their own, and they do not attend school. Denise Dossignon lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Denise Dossignon has been selling plates and footwear for five years through the distribution system. As a secondary activity, she also sells bissap juice (hibiscus). She buys her merchandise locally and in city of Benin.

To achieve customer satisfaction, and to increase her sales and revenue, Denise Dossignon is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group WANGNINAN 20. This credit will help them to bolster their activities and their profits.

loans.use: to buy plates and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon is 40 years old, married and the father of three children. For the last 14 years, he has earned a living by repairing vehicles. His business is doing well and now has four employees and many customers. Since becoming a client of Faulu Kenya, he has started to save because he has learned about financial management. He hopes to expand his business in the future, employ more people and buy a piece of land. He is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for an auto repair shop.

loans.name: Athman

texts.en: Athman is 29 years old, single, and has earned a living for the past year by raising poultry for sale. He lives in the town of Kilifi and has been successful in this line of work. He was recently introduced to KADET LTD and is requesting his first loan, which he will use to buy buy more chicks to raise and sell later at a profit. He will use the additional profit made possible by this loan to expand his business and achieve his goal of having a happy, prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti is 33 years old, married and earns a living by selling food from her stall in Miritini, Mombasa. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and is requesting her second loan, which she will use to buy a variety of food stuffs as well as new chairs, tables and serving dishes. She will use the profits she expects to earn to repay her loan and expand her business. Her goal for the future is to excel in her current line of work.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food stuffs and new chairs, tables and serving dishes.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en: Maimuna is 32 years old, married and has earned a living for the last four years by selling charcoal to the residents of Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She supplements her income by selling coconuts. She is doing very well and is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. She will use the additional income she earns to improve her coconut business. Her goal for the future is to make her businesses more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides

loans.name: Damaris Del Pilar

texts.es:
Damaris, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo pues necesita invertir más en la tienda, conprándose gaseosas, productos no perecederos como arroz y cafe, azúcar, productos enlatados sardinas, atun, también otros materiales que sean necesarios para sus clientes, pues entre más disponibilidad tenga de productos así será la demanda que podrá recibir de sus clientes.

El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior logró mejorar sus ventas, ya que ofreció mayor variedad de productos a los clientes, esto ha mejorado su situación económica para ella y para su familia.
texts.en:
Damaris has decided on a new loan because she needs to invest more in the store.  She will buy soft drinks and non-perishable products like rice, coffee, sugar, canned goods, sardines, and tuna.  She will also buy other materials that her customers need.  The more availability of products that she has, the more demand there will be from her customers.

The effect  the previous loan had was to improve her sales.  This is because she offered a greater variety of products to her customers.  This has improved her financial situation and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carolina, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque,  considera ser necesaria una nueva inversión es un negocio en la venta de frutas y verduras, manifiesta que tiene dos personas dependientes quienes le ayuda a vender en el negocio de manera ambulante, se comprara tomates, cebollas,  papas, plátanos, manzanas, bananos, repollos, entre otra variedad de productos que existen en el mercado.

Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, que le ayudó a mejorar el negocio, ya que se dedicaba a la venta de atol, y hoy en día está dedicada a la venta de fruta y de verdura este rubro le ha generado mejores ingresos por eso considera mejor mantenerse en este tipo de negocio, cuenta con un local en el mercado donde puede expandirse más con sus productos y a futuro para mejorar.
texts.en:
Carolina is requesting a new loan because she thinks further investment in her fruits and vegetables business in needed given that she has two street vendors who help her.  She will buy tomatoes, onions,  potatoes, plantains, apples, bananas, cabbages, and other market products.

Her prior loan truly helped her improve her business. Previously, she was selling cornflour drinks, and now she sells fruits and vegetables, which generates more income. She thinks it is better to continue this business and has a stand in the market where she can offer more products and improve her future prospects.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions,  potatoes, plantains, apples, bananas, and cabbages.

loans.name: Nigor

texts.ru:
Нигор родилась 1948 году в Вахдате. Она вдова. У нее один ребенок. 
Нигора окончила Университет Предпринимательства и Сервиса. Она работала почти во всех сферах бизнеса. 
Нигора на сегодняшний день занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает национальные платья. 
Торговлей Нигора занимается пятнадцать лет. Она берет кредит на сумму 2300 долларов США для покупки тканей и платьев.
texts.en: Nigora was born in 1948 in Vahdat.  She is a widow and has one child.  Nigora graduated from the Entrepreneurship and Service University.  She has worked in almost all business areas.  Today, Nigora is involved in sales at a market.  She sells national dresses.  Nigora has been in sales for fifteen years.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $2300 to purchase fabrics and dresses.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and dresses

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru:
Исмоил родился 1969 году. Он проживает в городе Вахдат. Живет вместе с женой. У него пятеро детей. 
Исмоил по специальности водитель. Он предоставляет услугу такси. Исмоил развозит пассажиров по маршруту Душанбе - Вахдат и по городу Вахдат. Исмоил имеет богатый опыт в этой области. 
Он берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля с целю предоставления безопасной услуги. Также Исмоил хочет провести капитальный ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Ismoil was born in 1969.  He lives in the city of Vahdat together with his wife.  They have five children.  Ismoil is a driver.  He provides a taxi service.  Ismoil transports passengers along the Dushanbe-Vahdat route and within the city of Vahdat.  Ismoil has a rich experience in this area.  He is requesting this loan to repair his car in order to provide a safe service.  Ismoil also wants to make major repairs in his house.

loans.use: to repair his car and house

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
This is Estelita, She previously accessed an 9,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Estelita dreams to expand and grow her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 48 years old.  She owns a food stall in Kiembeni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of six children. She has been selling food for the past ten years.

This marks her first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes.

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and also in the expansion of her business. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат- молодая женщина, у неё дети и она воспитывает их без мужа, так как по семейным обстоятельствам она развелась.Она фармацевт по профессии и работает в двух аптеках по графику.Знает своё дело очень хорошо и имеет большой стаж.Хотя она получает зарплату в двух местах, она не может накопить деньги на крупную  покупку.Её дочь уже выросла и она хочет купить ей ювелирные изделия на приданное.Уже надо  покупать приданное,потому что она скоро планирует  выдать дочь замуж.Она рада, что узнала о нашей организации и обратилась к нам за финансовой поддержкой.
texts.en: Mamlakat is a young woman.  She has children, whom she is raising without a husband because she got divorced due to family circumstances.  She is a pharmacist and works at two pharmacies according to a schedule.  She knows her business very well and has a lot of experience in it.  Despite the fact that she earns a salary in two places, she cannot save money for a major purchase.  Her daughter is already grown, and Mamlakat wants to buy her jewelry for a dowry.  She needs to buy the dowry because she plans to marry off her daughter soon.  Mamlakat is happy to have learned about our organization and to request financial assistance from us.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud has had his business for more than 15 years. He sells men's shoes. His skills help him to develop the business. Mahmud brings goods from China. He has a wide assortment and many customers. He has a lovely wife and 3 children.  Mahmud’s son helps him with the business. Mahmud wants to open a new selling place in the local market. He has many friends and sometimes meets with them after the work day.  He wants to develop the business, but no one can help him.  He is asking for a loan to buy goods and open a new selling place. He waits your help and support.

loans.use: To purchase a new assortment of shoes

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru:
Фаридун проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 22 года. Он живет вместе с женой. Фаридун недавно окончил университет, он программист. Фаридун еще не устроился на работу по профессии. Он решил поработать таксистом. В студенческие годы Фаридун подрабатывал, предоставляя услугу такси.
Фаридун берет кредит для приобретения нового автомобиля и в дальнейшем хочет установить в машине оборудование для природного газа.
texts.en: Faridun lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 22 years old.  He lives together with his wife.  Faridun recently graduated from a university as a programmer, but he has yet to find work in his field.  So he decided to work as a taxi driver.  During his student years, Faridun worked part-time, providing a taxi service.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a new car and wants to install a natural gas conversion in the car in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Somoeurn's Group

texts.en: Residing in the Sangke district of Battambang Province, Somoeurn is 44 years old and married. She has 8 children, three of whom mainly depend on her as they are still at school. For the family's basic needs, she has been working on three hectares of farmland for growing corn and cassava. From her current business, she is able to earn about 21,000 Cambodia Riel (KHR). She has used the past three loans successfully. She paid back all the loans, which have helped her to sustain her big family. She joins this cycle with another member. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion, KHR 300,000, to buy fertilizer for her cash-crop. She believes that her business will gradually improve so that she can earn more income for keeping her children until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cash-crop

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y  empeñosa. Su pareja es Neliño, el padre de su hijo. Vive en compañía de sus padres, su pareja, su hijo y su hermano, en la casa de sus padres.
Su actividad es la venta de comida rápida como salchipapa (salchicha y papas fritas), pollo broaster, salchipollo, entre otros. Lo cual realiza en el frontis de su vivienda, donde instala su carrito freidor, todas las noches, teniendo como sus clientes a los transeúntes de la zona, vecinos y amistades.  Se inició en esta actividad  hace más de un año y actualmente le ayuda su cuñada en la atención a los clientes. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus platillos, logrando acabar todo lo que prepara. Esto le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual solventar los gastos de su hogar, pues ha tenido muchas necesidades económicas por los bajos ingresos. Pero ahora se siente más aliviada por tener un oficio y sentirse una persona productiva. Por eso tiene planes y desea mejorar el espacio donde pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes. 

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que espera pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse muy bien con su banco comunal, pues lo considera ser un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de víveres e ingredientes para la preparación sus comidas; como papas, aceite, harina, carne de pollo y otros. También  realizará algunas mejoras en el frontis de su casa instalando un techo provisional, mesas y sillas.
texts.en:
Matilde, 41, is a hardworking and enterprising woman. Her life partner is Neliño, the father of her son. She lives with her parents, partner, son, and her brother in their parent's home.

She sells fast foods like salchipapa (sausage and French fries), roasted chicken, kebabs, and other foods from the front of her house, where she has a fryer. Every night she serves customers: visitors in the area, neighbors, and friends. She began the business about a year ago, and her sister-in-law is now helping her serve customers. She thinks the business is quite profitable given the demand for her food and that she is able to sell everything she makes. This allows her to earn enough to meet household expenses. She has had financial problems because of low income, but she feels relieved to have a profession and to feel productive. Now she has plans and wishes to improve the space to better serve her customers. 

This is her first loan cycle with the institution MFP, with which she hopes to make her plans a reality. She is very comfortable with her communal bank as she thinks the group is united and caring. She will use the loan amount of 800 nuevos soles to buy supplies and ingredients to prepare her food such as potatoes, oil, flour, chicken, and so forth. She will also make improvements to the front of her house, installing a seasonal roof, tables, and chairs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her prepared foods and to repair the section of her house where she serves her customers.

loans.name: Ybette

texts.es:
Ybette tiene 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchos deseos de superación. Está casada con Ramón, quien es agricultor y el padre de sus tres hijos: Juliana de 22 años, Miguel de 18 años y Antonela de 6 años. 

Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, para lo cual cuenta con una bodega instalada en su propia vivienda, donde también vende frutas frescas. Para esto se levanta muy de temprano y se dirige a los mercados donde compra las frutas más frescas de los productores y los lleva a su bodega para venderlos a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos. Lleva dedicándose a este negocio desde hace 3 años y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la buena demanda que tiene sus productos y las ganancias que le deja. Y le gusta porque le permite estar en casa, cerca de sus hijos y así poder atenderlos, además de brindarle una ocupación, y generarle un ingreso económico para poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. 

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con la institución MFP y se siente contenta de contar con un apoyo financiero para continuar con sus objetivos. Por lo cual  se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, para tener un buen record crediticio y tener acceso a más créditos en el futuro. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera buenas personas.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para surtir su bodega, abarrotes de primera necesidad como arroz, conservas, fideos y otros, a precio por mayor  para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Ybette, 44, is a hardworking and dedicated woman with a lot of desire to succeed. She is married to Ramon who is a farmer and the father of her three children: Juliana, 22, Miguel, 18, and Antonela, 6. 

Her business is selling groceries for which she has a shop set up in her own living quarters where she also sells fresh fruits. To this end she gets up very early in the morning and goes to the markets where she buys the freshest fruits from the producers, and takes them to her shop to sell to her customers who are principally her own neighbors. She has devoted herself to this business for three years and, up to now, has been handling it on her own. She believes her business is quite profitable because her products are in demand and because of the earnings they provide her. She likes it because it allows her to be at home near her children so she can watch after them, as well as providing her with an occupation and generating financial income so she can support her husband with household expenses and the education of their children. 

This is her second loan with the institution MFP and she is happy to have financial support in order to keep on towards her goals. Therefore she commits to making her payments so she will have a good credit record and be able to access more loans in the future. She also comments that she is happy with her communal bank since she knows its members and considers them to be good people. 

With the amount requested of 1,000 Peruvian soles she will invest in purchasing more merchandise to stock her shop, basic grocery staples such as rice, conserves, beans and other items at wholesale prices in order to have larger profit margins.

loans.use: to purchase more basic grocery items for stocking her shop.

loans.name: Wend N So Group

texts.fr:
Mme JUSTINE est responsable du groupe WEND N SO. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 08mois.02 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Mme fait la restauration depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Toecin. Ses clients sont les habitants du quartier.

Elle veut s’acheter  15 plats d’haricot, 01 sac de 25kg de riz.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  renforcer son activité et scolariser ses enfants. Elle ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame JUSTINE in charge of the WEND N SO group. She is married and is the mother of 4 children between the ages of 8 months and 10 years. Two of her children go to school. She has 4 people under her supervision.

Madame has been in the restaurant business for 7 years. She buys her supplies at the Toecin market, and her customers live in the neighborhood.

She would like to buy 15 plates of beans and one 25kg bag of rice. 

With the profits, she would like to strengthen her business and send her children to school. She would like to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 15 plates of beans and one 25kg bag of rice.

loans.name: Rysbubu

texts.ru: Рысбубу проживает в селе «8 марта» на севере Кыргызстана со своей семьей. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности, Рысбубу с мужем откармливают скот, начав этот бизнес еще 40 лет назад. На сегодняшний день, хозяйство Рысбубу насчитывает 8 овец, 1 корову, 11 коз, 1 лошадь и позволяет получать около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Рысбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы  в целях увеличения удоев молока.  Доходы Рысбубу планирует вложить в постройку сарая.
texts.en: Rysbubu lives together with her family in the "8-March" village in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  Just like many families in rural areas, Rysbubu and her husband fattens up livestock, having started this business 40 years ago.  Today her business contains eight sheep, one cow, eleven goats and one horse, and allows her to earn about 5,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Rysbubu requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy a cow in order to increase milk volume.  She plans to invest the earnings into building a barn.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase mechanized farming equipment to enhance his crop

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei owns and rents his land of about 6 hectares. On this land he grows carrots, tomatoes and potatoes. Sergei's wife helps him to farm. They have a 14 year-old daughter who goes to school. Their 22 year old daughter has finished university with a major in English. Sergei and his wife need you to help them finance irrigation equipment because in the Northern Crimea the situation with water infrastructure is very troubling. Farmers can no longer develop agriculture without an investment into new equipment which will bring fresh water supply and electricity. 

Sergei's wife owns a 4 hectare land in a nearby region. However, this land lies idle because the family struggles to cultivate current lands to their capacity. It is their great dream to develop existing 6 hectares and have enough resources to begin working on a piece of land in a neighbouring region.

loans.use: To purchase an irrigation system

loans.name: Wendbenedo Group

texts.fr:
Mme POKO ANNE est responsable du groupe WENDBENEDO. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 02ans.01 va à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des habits, chaussures et pagnes depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les habitants du secteur.

Elle veut s’acheter  04pièces de pagnes, 30 paires de chaussures et 05 douzaines d’habits.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  agrandir son activité de commerce. Elle ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anne Poko is the leader of the WENDBENEDO group.  She is married and the mother of two children.  The older one is twelve and the younger one is two.  The older one goes to school. She has two people in her care. 

Mrs. Poko has been selling clothing for eight years.  She gets her supplies at the market in sector 10 of the city.  Her customers are residents of the sector.  

She wants to buy four bolts of pagnes (colorful fabric used to make clothing), 30 pairs of shoes, and five dozen articles of clothing.

With her profits, she would like to grow her business. Her goal is to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy four bolts of pagnes, 30 pairs of shoes, and five dozen articles of clothing.

loans.name: Zijovaddin

texts.ru: Зиёваддин мужчина в возрасте.Все его дети уже женаты, сыновья в Российской Федерации на заработках вместе с матерью.Там они имеют постоянное место жительство и работу и ежемесячно присылают домой  деньги.Зиёваддин копит эти ресурсы и присматривает здесь за большой семьёй.Вместе с ним живут его невестки и внуки.Все заботы лежат на его плечах.Сам Зиёваддин не сидит без работы.Дома он откармливает скот  и ему помогают в этом его внуки.Зиёваддин хочет купить еще несколько голов мелкорогатого   скота и расширить свой оборот.Сейчас в горах много травы и очень выгодно откармливать скот в это время.Надеется получить хорошую прибыль и если дела пойдут хорошо, планирует постоянно с нами сотрудничать.
texts.en: Zijovaddin is an elderly man.  All of his children are married, and the sons are working in the Russian Federation together with their mother.  They have a permanent residence and work there and send money home monthly.  Zijovaddin saves this money and looks after a large family here.  His daughters-in-law and grandchildren live with him.  All of the responsibilities lay on his shoulders.  Zijovaddin does not sit without work.  He fattens up livestock at home, and his grandsons help him with this.  Zijovaddin wants to buy several more heads of small livestock and increase his turnover.  There is currently a lot of grass in the mountains, which makes it advantageous to fatten up livestock at this time.  He hopes to make a good profit, and if business goes well, plans to partner with us permanently.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dimas Marin

texts.es:
Dimas, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder mejorar el negocio en la venta de mariscos, dicho negocio lo sigue administrando con su esposa, actualmente comprara  pescado, camarones, conchas, que son los necesarios para poder ofrecer clientela, Este préstamos ayudara para poder darle continuidad al negocio manteniendo productos frescos y de calidad.

Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo que le ayudó a mejorar su situación en la familia, cubriendo los gastos correspondientes en el mejoramiento de la vivienda y tambien invirtiendo en el mismo negocio.
texts.en:
Dimas is seeking a new loan in order to improve his seafood business. He continues running said business with his wife. This time he will buy fish, shrimp and conchs which are needed for offering to the clientele. This loan will help him provide continuity to the business by keeping fresh quality products. 

The previous loan had a positive effect in that it helped him improve his family situation, covering the costs related to improvements to his housing and also investing in the same business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, shrimp and conchs.
